NEW YORK  His feet dangling beneath the steering wheel little Tafiri tried his best to pilot the dieselpowered school bus Monday afternoon PERIOD

But the empty 26000pound coach lurched forward crushing to death Amber Sadiq  police said PERIOD

As she grieved with relatives in the familys apartment Tuesday Ambers mother thought of the boy who faces a criminally negligent homicide charge in her daughters death PERIOD

 Ambers mother Raina Herrera said inside her apartment to a visitor surrounded by grieving relatives PERIOD

 said Carlos Peguero a family friend PERIOD 

Tafiri standing about  feet and weighing less than  pounds had boarded the parked bus and released the emergency brake police said PERIOD

In moments Det PERIOD Brian Gregory testified in Brooklyn Family Court Tuesday the school bus traveled  feet and slammed into a light pole crushing Amber PERIOD

 Gregory said on the stand as the little boy sat between his two lawyers chewing on a sleeve of his red hooded sweatshirt PERIOD He 

Last Friday the little boy whom Newsday is identifying only by his first name at the courts request was sent home from school after mischievously boarding a school bus PERIOD

The boy would be better off in a juvenile home said Judge Maureen McLeod who did not level formal charges or a sentence Tuesday PERIOD

 McLeod said after prosecutors recounted Tafiris long history of school truancy and unsupervised wanderings in his neighborhood PERIOD

Members of the boys family including a grandmother attended the court hearing Tuesday but declined to comment PERIOD

The bus driver Jean Lima had parked the bus and was having lunch with a friend down the street during his break police have said PERIOD Police have not charged him PERIOD

 said Norman Turk a Brooklyn attorney representing the bus company PERIOD The driver was not disciplined Turk said PERIOD

The two children lived across the street from each other  Amber a bright and promising student at PS  friends and relatives said the other prosecutors said a boy who had accumulated  absent days and nearly two weeks of late attendance at the same school PERIOD

Tafiri had been suspended three times the last time on Friday after the initial bus incident said Assistant Corporation counsel Suzette Rivera PERIOD

Rivera said the family had been known to the citys Administration for Childrens Services because of lax supervision and said Tafiri is not allowed to go on school trips because he needs personal handling PERIOD Sharman Stein a spokeswoman for ACS declined to comment PERIOD
